brandIdentity.designSummary: This design features a contemporary editorial style with a strong emphasis on large, geometric sans-serif typography and bold color blocking. The layout is modular and grid-based, balancing text and images with generous negative space and asymmetrical compositions. The color palette is warm and earthy, dominated by a bright red for emphasis, deep chocolate brown for grounding, muted beige as a neutral background, and mustard yellow for highlight areas. Typography hierarchy is clear with massive uppercase headings and light, readable body text. The overall aesthetic is minimal yet impactful, combining modernity with an artistic edge, suitable for creative and cultural brands.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Confident, modern, artistic, and bold with a sophisticated yet approachable personality.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'primary' color for key headings, call-to-action blocks, and emphasis elements to draw immediate attention. The 'primaryForeground' color should be used for text and icons placed on the 'primary' background to ensure clear readability. The 'secondary' color serves as a grounding tone for backgrounds, text blocks, and navigation elements, paired with 'secondaryForeground' for text to maintain contrast and warmth. The 'background' color provides a neutral, soft canvas that balances the stronger colors and supports content legibility. The 'highlightYellow' custom color is best used for large background sections or accent areas to create visual interest and break up the layout. Colors should be combined thoughtfully to maintain strong contrast and accessibility, with 'primary' and 'secondary' colors never used together without sufficient spacing or neutral buffer.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The 'primaryForeground' on 'primary' background meets WCAG AA standards for large text and AAA for normal text. The 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' background also meets WCAG AA contrast ratios for body text. The 'background' color paired with 'secondary' and 'primary' colors provides sufficient contrast for readability. The 'highlightYellow' should be used with 'secondary' or 'primaryForeground' text to maintain accessibility compliance.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font in large uppercase sizes to create strong visual hierarchy and impact. Pair with lighter paragraph fonts to maintain readability and balance. Maintain tight letter spacing for headings to preserve the bold, compact look. Ensure headings contrast strongly with background colors, preferably using 'primary' or 'secondary' colors with their respective foregrounds.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings using this font with 'primaryForeground' on 'primary' or 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' backgrounds meet WCAG AA contrast standards for all sizes.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font in sentence case with moderate line height and letter spacing for comfortable reading. Pair with bold headings to create clear typographic contrast. Text color should primarily be 'secondary' or 'secondaryForeground' on 'background' to ensure legibility. Avoid using paragraph fonts in all caps to maintain readability.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Paragraph text using 'secondary' on 'background' or 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' meets WCAG AA contrast ratios for body text.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section uses a large, bold heading placed asymmetrically across the layout's quadrants, balancing text blocks with images and color blocks. This placement creates dynamic visual tension and guides the viewer's eye through the content. The typography is oversized and tightly spaced, emphasizing the brand's confident and modern tone.

components.containers: Containers are defined by solid color blocks or thin borders, creating clear separation between content areas. Background colors from the palette are used to differentiate sections, with ample padding to maintain clarity and focus.
components.images: Images are presented in clean rectangular frames, sometimes rotated or offset to add dynamism. They are integrated within color blocks or alongside text, maintaining balance and visual interest without overpowering the typography.
components.buttons: Buttons are minimal and rectangular with solid fills or outlines in the 'primary' color. Text on buttons uses 'primaryForeground' for contrast. Buttons maintain a clean, modern look consistent with the overall design.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are minimal, geometric, and monochromatic, typically using the 'secondaryForeground' or 'primaryForeground' colors to maintain visual harmony with the typography and color blocks.
graphicElements.illustrations: No illustrations are used; the design relies on photography and typography for visual storytelling.
graphicElements.stickers: No stickers or badges are present; emphasis is on clean, bold typography and color blocking.

brandIdentity.designSummary: The design features a minimalistic and spacious layout with a soft off-white background that creates a calm and neutral canvas. The primary color is a deep forest green used consistently for headings, text, icons, and buttons, conveying reliability and eco-consciousness. A lighter pastel green serves as a secondary color for backgrounds and highlights, adding freshness and subtle vibrancy. Typography combines a modern sans-serif font for headings with a monospaced or typewriter-style font for body text, emphasizing clarity and technical precision. The layout is balanced and column-based with generous white space, rounded corners on images and buttons, and a clean navigation system with pill-shaped buttons. Graphic elements are minimal and line-based, supporting the clean and professional aesthetic. Overall, the design communicates a harmonious blend of technology and sustainability, suitable for a wide range of industries focused on innovation and environmental responsibility.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Professional, trustworthy, and forward-thinking with a focus on sustainability and innovation. The tone is calm, precise, and approachable, reflecting a brand that is both technologically advanced and environmentally conscious.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'primary' color for all main text elements, headings, icons, and primary buttons to establish brand recognition and ensure readability. The 'secondary' color is ideal for backgrounds of interactive elements such as highlighted job listings and call-to-action buttons, providing a fresh and inviting contrast to the 'primary' color. The 'background' color should be used as the base canvas for pages to maintain a soft, neutral environment that reduces eye strain and enhances content focus. Text on 'primary' backgrounds should use 'primaryForeground' to ensure high contrast and accessibility, while text on 'secondary' backgrounds should use 'secondaryForeground' for clarity. Avoid mixing colors outside this palette to maintain brand consistency and a cohesive visual identity.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The 'primary' color (#0B3D2E) on the 'background' (#F5F5F0) provides excellent contrast exceeding WCAG AA standards for both normal and large text. Text in 'primaryForeground' (#FFFFFF) on 'primary' backgrounds also meets WCAG AA contrast requirements. The 'secondary' color (#C7E6C1) with 'secondaryForeground' (#0B3D2E) ensures sufficient contrast for readability on interactive elements. Overall, the palette supports accessible design for users with visual impairments and maintains legibility across devices.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font for all major titles and section headers to create a clear visual hierarchy. Italic styles can be applied selectively to emphasize key words or concepts, adding subtle dynamism without compromising readability. Pair headings with the monospaced paragraph font to balance modernity with technical precision. Maintain consistent spacing and avoid overcrowding to preserve the minimalistic aesthetic. Ensure headings use the 'primary' color for strong brand presence and accessibility.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings in 'primary' color on 'background' meet WCAG AA contrast standards, ensuring readability for users with visual impairments.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font for all body text, captions, and smaller UI text to maintain clarity and a technical feel. The monospaced style supports the brand's technology focus and contrasts well with the sans-serif headings. Text should primarily use the 'primary' color on the 'background' for optimal readability. Maintain adequate line height and spacing to enhance legibility, especially for longer text blocks.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Paragraph text in 'primary' color on 'background' meets WCAG AA contrast requirements, supporting accessible reading experiences.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section places the headline and key messaging in the top third of the viewport, aligned left to create a natural reading flow. This placement is visually balanced by a large image on the right with rounded corners, creating a harmonious split layout. The typography uses large, bold headings with italic emphasis on key words to draw attention, supported by smaller, monospaced body text below. Generous white space surrounds the text, enhancing focus and readability while maintaining a clean, modern aesthetic.

components.containers: Containers use soft rounded corners and subtle background colors like 'secondary' for emphasis. They maintain consistent padding and margins to create a clean, organized structure. Borders are minimal or absent, relying on color and spacing for separation.
components.images: Images have rounded corners to soften the visual impact and integrate smoothly with the overall minimalistic design. They are balanced with text content and sized to maintain harmony within the grid layout.
components.buttons: Primary buttons use the 'primary' color with white text ('primaryForeground'), featuring rounded edges and a solid fill for clear call-to-action emphasis. Secondary buttons or less prominent actions use the 'secondary' background with 'secondaryForeground' text, often outlined or with subtle shadows to maintain hierarchy.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are minimal, line-based, and use the 'primary' color to maintain consistency and clarity. They are simple and functional, supporting navigation and interaction without distraction.
graphicElements.illustrations: No prominent illustrations are used; the design relies on realistic photography with natural colors, which are excluded from the core palette.
graphicElements.stickers: Stickers or badges, such as the 'Top 20' label, use the 'secondary' background with 'primary' text and rounded corners, maintaining the brand's clean and approachable style.

brandIdentity.designSummary: This brand design features a bold and modern aesthetic centered around a vibrant green background color that dominates the header and key sections, paired with high-contrast black typography and clean white content backgrounds. The typography is a key visual element, with an oversized, uppercase sans-serif font used for the main brand name, conveying strength and professionalism. Navigation and body text use a smaller, clean sans-serif font in black for clarity and simplicity. The layout is spacious and balanced, employing generous white space and a two-column grid for project showcases. UI components are minimalistic, with subtle rounded corners on text overlays adding softness to the otherwise sharp design. The overall style is minimalistic and modern, emphasizing clarity, confidence, and a professional tone suitable for creative or architectural firms.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Confident, professional, modern, and authoritative with a fresh and approachable edge.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: The color system is strictly neutral to maintain the technical aesthetic. The 'primary' color (Forest Green) is the only accent and is used for primary actions and key highlights. It passes accessibility checks against the 'background', allowing for flexible usage. The 'background' is pure white. The 'foreground' is pure black. Use the 'secondary' color (Neutral Light Gray) for subtle backgrounds or dividers, always paired with 'secondaryForeground' (Neutral Dark Gray) for text. Do not introduce cool or warm grays; stick to pure neutral values.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: All combinations are WCAG AA compliant. 1) 'primary' + 'primaryForeground' (Green/White) ratio is ~5.16:1. 2) 'primary' + 'background' (Green/White) ratio is ~5.16:1. 3) 'secondary' + 'secondaryForeground' (Light Gray/Dark Gray) ratio is ~10.6:1. 4) 'background' + 'foreground' (White/Black) ratio is 21:1.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font for all major titles and brand names, especially in uppercase to emphasize boldness and clarity. Pair with the paragraph font to create a clear typographic hierarchy. Maintain generous spacing around headings to enhance readability and impact. Avoid using the heading font for body text to preserve legibility.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings using the 'primaryForeground' color on the 'primary' or 'secondary' backgrounds meet WCAG AA contrast requirements, ensuring clear visibility and accessibility.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font for all body text, navigation links, and smaller informational text. Maintain consistent line height and spacing for readability. Combine with the heading font to create a balanced typographic system. Use 'primaryForeground' or 'secondaryForeground' colors depending on background for optimal contrast.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Body text colors on their respective backgrounds meet WCAG AA standards for legibility, supporting accessible reading experiences.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section places the brand name and introductory text anchored in the top third of the viewport, with the brand name aligned left and navigation aligned right on a solid 'primary' background. This placement creates immediate brand recognition and a strong visual hierarchy. The large heading font dominates the space, while the smaller body text is contained in a white rounded rectangle overlay on the hero image, providing contrast and focus. This approach balances bold typography with spacious layout and clear content separation.

components.containers: Containers use solid 'secondary' backgrounds with generous padding and rounded corners for text overlays, creating clear separation from images and backgrounds. The use of white backgrounds for content blocks ensures readability and focus.
components.images: Images are large, high-quality, and full-width or half-width depending on context, with no visible borders or shadows, emphasizing natural presentation and visual impact.
components.buttons: Buttons are minimal or text-based with underlined links in 'primaryForeground' color on 'primary' backgrounds, maintaining simplicity and clarity. Interactive states use subtle underline or color changes.

graphicElements.icons: No visible icons are present, maintaining a clean and minimal interface focused on typography and imagery.
graphicElements.illustrations: No illustrations are used, reinforcing the professional and photographic focus of the design.
graphicElements.stickers: No stickers or badges are present, keeping the design uncluttered and straightforward.

brandIdentity.designSummary: This brand design embodies a refined, artisanal aesthetic with a minimalistic and elegant visual style. The layout is spacious and balanced, utilizing generous white space and a clear column-based grid system to create a clean and modular structure. The color palette centers on warm, earthy tones including a deep brown as the primary color, a soft cream/off-white background, and a muted pale yellow as a secondary background accent. Typography features a classic serif font for headings, conveying sophistication and timeless craftsmanship, paired with a clean, modern sans-serif for body text to ensure readability and neutrality. UI components such as buttons and icons are understated, using the primary brown color for subtle emphasis without heavy decoration. The overall composition emphasizes natural materials and authenticity, with large, warm-toned images complementing the textual content. This design style is versatile and suitable for brands that want to communicate quality, warmth, and artisanal values in a minimal yet elegant manner.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Sophisticated, warm, artisanal, timeless, and refined.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'primary' color predominantly for text, icons, and key UI elements such as navigation links and footer backgrounds to establish a grounded and sophisticated tone. The 'background' color serves as the main canvas, providing a clean and spacious feel that enhances readability and highlights content. The 'secondary' color is best applied to large background blocks or sections to introduce warmth and subtle contrast without overpowering the design. Text or UI elements placed on the 'secondary' background should use the 'secondaryForeground' color to maintain legibility and visual harmony. Avoid introducing bright or saturated colors to preserve the natural and artisanal feel. The palette supports high contrast combinations between 'primary' and 'background' for accessibility, while the 'secondary' color adds depth and softness to the overall visual hierarchy. This restrained color system ensures a timeless and elegant brand presence.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The combination of 'primary' (#4A2F1B) text on 'background' (#FFFBF0) meets WCAG AA and AAA contrast standards for all text sizes, ensuring excellent readability. Similarly, 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' (#F0F0D8) also meets WCAG AA contrast requirements for body text and larger headings. The palette's high contrast between dark and light tones supports accessibility across UI components and content areas.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font for all primary titles, quotes, and large textual elements to convey refinement and craftsmanship. Pair with the paragraph font to create a clear typographic hierarchy, ensuring headings stand out with ample spacing and size differentiation. Maintain consistent line heights and letter spacing to preserve readability and elegance. Avoid using the heading font for body text to prevent visual fatigue. When placed on 'background' or 'secondary' colors, use the 'primary' or 'secondaryForeground' colors respectively to ensure contrast and legibility.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings set in 'fraunces' with 'primary' color on 'background' meet WCAG AA and AAA contrast standards, supporting accessibility for all users.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font for all body text, navigation links, and smaller informational content. It complements the serif headings by providing clarity and neutrality. Maintain comfortable line heights and letter spacing to enhance readability, especially in longer text blocks. Use 'primary' color for text on 'background' and 'secondaryForeground' for text on 'secondary' backgrounds. Ensure sufficient contrast and avoid overly small font sizes to maintain accessibility.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Body text in 'open sans' with 'primary' color on 'background' meets WCAG AA contrast requirements for normal and large text, ensuring legibility.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section typography is anchored in the top third of the viewport, creating an immediate focal point upon page load. Large, elegant serif headings dominate this area, paired with smaller sans-serif subheadings or calls to action. This placement leverages generous white space around the text, enhancing its prominence and readability. The text aligns left, maintaining a classic editorial feel, and is balanced by large imagery or negative space on the right or below. This approach establishes a refined and inviting introduction to the brand.

components.containers: Containers are minimalistic with no heavy borders or shadows, relying on spacing and background color shifts such as 'secondary' to delineate sections. They maintain consistent padding to ensure content breathes and aligns with the grid system. The use of 'background' and 'secondary' colors helps visually separate content areas without clutter.
components.images: Images are large, natural, and warm-toned, integrated seamlessly with text blocks. They serve as focal points but do not introduce additional colors to the palette. Images have clean edges with no heavy frames or overlays, supporting the minimal and elegant aesthetic.
components.buttons: Buttons are understated with text or border in the 'primary' color. They have no heavy shadows or gradients, maintaining a flat and clean look. Primary buttons use solid 'primary' backgrounds with 'primaryForeground' text for emphasis, while secondary buttons use transparent backgrounds with 'primary' borders and text.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are simple line-based, using the 'primary' color to maintain consistency and subtlety. They are minimal and functional, supporting navigation and user interaction without drawing excessive attention.
graphicElements.illustrations: No illustrations are present, maintaining a clean and photographic-driven design language.
graphicElements.stickers: No stickers or badges are used, preserving the minimal and elegant brand presentation.

brandBook.toneOfVoice: Confident, modern, artistic, and bold with a sophisticated yet approachable personality.

components.images: Images are presented in clean rectangular frames, sometimes rotated or offset to add dynamism. They are integrated within color blocks or alongside text, maintaining balance and visual interest without overpowering the typography.
components.buttons: Buttons are minimal and rectangular with solid fills or outlines in the 'primary' color. Text on buttons uses 'primaryForeground' for contrast. Buttons maintain a clean, modern look consistent with the overall design.
components.containers: Containers are defined by solid color blocks or thin borders, creating clear separation between content areas. Background colors from the palette are used to differentiate sections, with ample padding to maintain clarity and focus.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font in large uppercase sizes to create strong visual hierarchy and impact. Pair with lighter paragraph fonts to maintain readability and balance. Maintain tight letter spacing for headings to preserve the bold, compact look. Ensure headings contrast strongly with background colors, preferably using 'primary' or 'secondary' colors with their respective foregrounds.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings using this font with 'primaryForeground' on 'primary' or 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' backgrounds meet WCAG AA contrast standards for all sizes.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font in sentence case with moderate line height and letter spacing for comfortable reading. Pair with bold headings to create clear typographic contrast. Text color should primarily be 'secondary' or 'secondaryForeground' on 'background' to ensure legibility. Avoid using paragraph fonts in all caps to maintain readability.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Paragraph text using 'secondary' on 'background' or 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' meets WCAG AA contrast ratios for body text.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section uses a large, bold heading placed asymmetrically across the layout's quadrants, balancing text blocks with images and color blocks. This placement creates dynamic visual tension and guides the viewer's eye through the content. The typography is oversized and tightly spaced, emphasizing the brand's confident and modern tone.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are minimal, geometric, and monochromatic, typically using the 'secondaryForeground' or 'primaryForeground' colors to maintain visual harmony with the typography and color blocks.
graphicElements.stickers: No stickers or badges are present; emphasis is on clean, bold typography and color blocking.
graphicElements.illustrations: No illustrations are used; the design relies on photography and typography for visual storytelling.

brandBook.designSummary: This design features a contemporary editorial style with a strong emphasis on large, geometric sans-serif typography and bold color blocking. The layout is modular and grid-based, balancing text and images with generous negative space and asymmetrical compositions. The color palette is warm and earthy, dominated by a bright red for emphasis, deep chocolate brown for grounding, muted beige as a neutral background, and mustard yellow for highlight areas. Typography hierarchy is clear with massive uppercase headings and light, readable body text. The overall aesthetic is minimal yet impactful, combining modernity with an artistic edge, suitable for creative and cultural brands.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'primary' color for key headings, call-to-action blocks, and emphasis elements to draw immediate attention. The 'primaryForeground' color should be used for text and icons placed on the 'primary' background to ensure clear readability. The 'secondary' color serves as a grounding tone for backgrounds, text blocks, and navigation elements, paired with 'secondaryForeground' for text to maintain contrast and warmth. The 'background' color provides a neutral, soft canvas that balances the stronger colors and supports content legibility. The 'highlightYellow' custom color is best used for large background sections or accent areas to create visual interest and break up the layout. Colors should be combined thoughtfully to maintain strong contrast and accessibility, with 'primary' and 'secondary' colors never used together without sufficient spacing or neutral buffer.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The 'primaryForeground' on 'primary' background meets WCAG AA standards for large text and AAA for normal text. The 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' background also meets WCAG AA contrast ratios for body text. The 'background' color paired with 'secondary' and 'primary' colors provides sufficient contrast for readability. The 'highlightYellow' should be used with 'secondary' or 'primaryForeground' text to maintain accessibility compliance.

initialPrompt: Create a professional, real-world hyper-local part-time job marketplace platform. Purpose: Connect students and job seekers with nearby local job providers for hourly or daily jobs. Features: Location-based job matching, role-based access for Job Seeker, Job Provider, Super Admin, Admin, and Moderator. Core features include authentication, job posting and application, in-app chat, payment with 5% commission, ratings, admin dashboard, and trust & safety systems. Tech stack: React.js frontend (mobile-first, map-based UI), Spring Boot backend (REST APIs, JWT, RBAC, MySQL). Required pages: Home, How It Works, Find Jobs, Post a Job, Pricing, Safety & Trust, Admin Panel, Login/Signup, Contact & Support. Design: Modern, clean, trust-focused, mobile-first. Goal: Scalable gig-economy platform for city-by-city deployment, suitable for production, startup pitching, and technical interviews.

It will connect students and job seekers with local job providers for hourly or daily jobs, featuring location-based matching, role-based access, job posting and application, in-app chat, payments with commission, ratings, and admin dashboards."
